attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
These e-petitions are the only means that the public, of all ages, can have a say in politics, other than an election which is a rare occurence.

It therefore seems very rude and disrespectful, after people take the time to sign them, that you start every response with the words 'The government currently has no plans...'

This shows how e-petitions exist for public relations and have absolutely no bearing on you or how you shape your policy.

Either you take these e-petitions (some of which get signatures into the millions) seriously or you should discontinue them and stop misleading the public into thinking that they have any say.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
